title: How safe is BitGo Wallet for Bitcoin storage? - Quora

response.answer_text: BitGo is a cryptocurrency wallet and vault service provider that offers its portfolio for individuals as well as organizations. BitGo did not become this popular online storing platform without an excellent set of features and services.  Security and ReliabilityBitGo offers various layers of protection for its users. First is the IP address whitelist which you need to confirm every time you sign in from a different computer. The second one is the 2-Factor authentication which can be used through Google Authenticator or Yubikey. Apart from the computer authentication, you can also use iOS or Android devices as an additional factor of login to protect your account from hacking attempts. There are many other powerful strength of BitGo . But you must be acquainted with what BitGo wallet. You can also go for wallet development and if you have an existing exchange in which you want to integrate wallet, then it makes sense to hire the right cryptocurrency wallet development company that assure you fully secure and scalable wallet solution so that your users have a gala time trading cryptocurrencies.

BitGo is considered as one of the safest options when it comes to Bitcoin storage. What BitGo (USA) offers is a centralized way to manage cryptocurrencies. There are other companies, which are offering comparable solutions like Cobo[1] (China), Custody Coinbase[2] (USA) and Tangany[3] (EU). All these services are offering custodian blockchain wallets for enterprise customers but also for personal usage. There are also non-custodian wallets, where the actual user owns and manages the responding private key. The private key is like a password to authorize access to the wallet itself. Once lost, it can never be restored. On the other side, the user doesn’t need to trust any third party to be trustworthy. There you have also to differentiate between software and hardware solutions. The software wallets are online or actual installed on the OS, which is considered less safe. Hardware wallet (like Ledger Nano S (EU)) are considered highly safe.
